intro: Borreria graminifolia, commonly known as the grassy borreria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It often grows in disturbed soils and can be found in open woodland or along roadsides. Borreria graminifolia is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
